intro: Astronium gracile var. acuminatum, commonly known as the Acuminated Starfruit Tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped fruits that resemble starfruits. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, with smooth, glossy leaves that are alternate and elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in greenish-white clusters, and it produces edible fruits that are consumed both fresh and in processed forms.
